newsitem.title: USA: Visio acquires assets from Boomerang.
newsitem.headline: Visio acquires assets from Boomerang.

text.p: Visio Corp said Thursday it has purchased source code and certain other assets of Boomerang Technology Inc. for $6.7 million, virtually completing the acquisition of the San Diego-based software developer.
Boomerang's nine software developers have worked for Visio since Jan. 1 and will form the new San Diego office of the Seattle-based maker of drawing software.
Boomerang was created by a group of former Softdesk Inc employees in October to create software compatible with the Autodesk Inc AutoCAD system.
Visio said it would incorporate the technology into a future product offering.
Leslie Dietz, director of finance for Visio, said the acquisition "gives us the opportunity to be much more competitive" with Autodesk in the two-dimensional technical drawing market.
She said the first products incorporating the new technology would not be available before the second half of 1997.
